title: How to Create an Apple and Pear Fruit Compote

steps.headline: Take about six apples of choice.
steps.description: Selecting different sorts will make the taste of the compote a little more interesting.

steps.headline: Clean the fruits.
steps.description: Remove their central cores with an apple core driller.

steps.headline: Chop the fruits.
steps.description: Do not peel them, just remove any damaged parts.

steps.headline: Add about one pear.
steps.description: Choose a sweet and ripe one (unpeeled), as it replaces the sugar. Treat  the same way as the apples.

steps.headline: Take a cooking vessel (pot).
steps.description: Add a bit of water, about two cups.

steps.headline: Cook at medium heating temperature.
steps.description: Keep a constant eye on it. Mostly the fruits will be done after a cooking time of 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Add one peeled orange to the fruits, in segments.
steps.description: Add a bit of lemon juice and/or a bit of cinnamon. One bark piece will do it.

steps.headline: When cooling down, add a bit of red wine and a bit of port wine or sherry, if using.
Serve warm or completely cooled, as preferred.
steps.description: Custard or vanilla sauce, preferably self made, are good to upgrade. Fried Dutch pancakes can be rolled and stuffed with the compote, warm or cool. Suitable for filling baked biscuit shells or with ice cream. A healthy dish also for children when suitable biscuits are soaked in (served as pap). For a summertime version You can take  still fresh tropical fruits like mango, ananas, a banana or / and a kiwi, some raspberries, plums etc. No sugar  necessary.

text: Take about six apples of choice. Selecting different sorts will make the taste of the compote a little more interesting. Clean the fruits. Remove their central cores with an apple core driller. Chop the fruits. Do not peel them, just remove any damaged parts. Add about one pear. Choose a sweet and ripe one (unpeeled), as it replaces the sugar. Treat  the same way as the apples. Take a cooking vessel (pot). Add a bit of water, about two cups. Cook at medium heating temperature. Keep a constant eye on it. Mostly the fruits will be done after a cooking time of 15 minutes. Add one peeled orange to the fruits, in segments. Add a bit of lemon juice and/or a bit of cinnamon. One bark piece will do it. When cooling down, add a bit of red wine and a bit of port wine or sherry, if using.  Serve warm or completely cooled, as preferred. Custard or vanilla sauce, preferably self made, are good to upgrade. Fried Dutch pancakes can be rolled and stuffed with the compote, warm or cool. Suitable for filling baked biscuit shells or with ice cream. A healthy dish also for children when suitable biscuits are soaked in (served as pap). For a summertime version You can take  still fresh tropical fruits like mango, ananas, a banana or / and a kiwi, some raspberries, plums etc. No sugar  necessary.
